intro: Hieracium dolinense, commonly known as the marsh hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland and marsh habitats in Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of tubular and ray florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with hairy, lance-shaped leaves and yellow flowers that bloom from June to August. It thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils and is often found in areas with standing water or heavy rainfall. Due to its ecological importance, it plays a role in supporting pollinators and maintaining wetland biodiversity.
